intro: Oxytropis selengensis, commonly known as Selengian locoweed, is a perennial herb native to the steppes and semi-desert regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its legume pods and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and compound leaves. Its small, yellow flowers bloom in early summer, and the plant is known for its toxic alkaloids, which can be harmful to livestock. Oxytropis selengensis is adapted to arid conditions and plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitats.
